title: Alice Cooper - N.Y.C. New York 1991-10-31 SOUNDBOARD
description:
Alice Cooper- vocals
Stef Burns- guitar
Derek Sherinian- keyboards
Hugh McDonald- bass
Mickey Curry- drums




Electric Lady Studio
N.Y.C. New York
October 31, 1991
touring "hey stoopid"
(etree lists this as happening on Sept. 13, 1991, 
but 10/31/91 was the broadcast date and it was 
announced as being a live broadcast.
Alice on Halloween night. Makes sense.)
runtime:  51:33




setlist:
 1: no more Mr. Nice Guy  2:20
 2: billion dollar babies  2:53
 3: only women bleed > ballad of Dwight Frye > wind up toy  4:45
 4: sick things  4:20
 5: announcer talk  1:12
 6: feed my Frankenstein  2:59
 7: cold ethyl 5:52
 8: love's a loaded gun 3:13
 10: I'm eighteen  4:31
 11: go to hell  5:30
 12: school's out  4:26
 13: hey stoopid  4:41



lineage:
  104.1 WBCN FM radio >
  Yamaha 500 reciever with digital tuner and wire antenna >
  Nak. 100 cassette deck (dolby off) >
  Maxell XLII 100 min. master cassette >
  played on Nak. 300 into soundforge (wav) >
  flac (sb's aligned) > torrentially yours.
  A this and that (and what was that?) production.
  Do not sell this recording.
  Share freely, losslessly and gaplessly.




comments:
 the stage introduction (if there was one) and the first note or two 
are apparently missing from the 1st song in here. it's complete from there. 
I believe that track one was the opening song of the set, and the etree
listing (posted before this recording) verifies that.
according to wikipedia, AC's earliest live album was recorded in 1977,
which means there is no official live account of Billion Dollar Babies, 
Killer, Love it to Death or School's out tours. that seems odd since 
songs from those albums comprise about half of Cooper's live setlist 
even in more recent years. there is also no listed official release 
from this tour. 
this was all recorded on one side of a Maxell XLII 100 min. cassette,
and it just barely fit.
